import React from "react"; import Notice from "../../../partials/content/Notice"; import CodeExample from "../../../partials/content/CodeExample"; import { Button, InputGroup, FormControl, DropdownButton, Dropdown } from "react-bootstrap"; export default class InputGroupExamplesPage extends React.Component { render() { return ( <> For more info please check the components's official{" "} demos & documentation
Place one add-on or button on either side of an input. You may also place one on both sides of an input. Remember to place{" "} <label>s outside the input group.

Add the relative form sizing classes to the{" "} InputGroup and contents within will automatically resizeno need for repeating the form control size classes on each element.

Default
Large
Use the InputGroup.Radio or{" "} InputGroup.Checkbox to add options to an input group.
While multiple inputss are supported visually, validation styles are only available for input groups with a single input.
First and last name
Multiple add-ons are supported and can be mixed
